I am definitely a pinky's loyalist to the original location. But this one is by far the better of the two. More space, the servers are extremely attentive and the food comes out so quickly. I ordered the Shirley temple for the first time and it was to die for! It's a great location to go to if you have children they give the kids chalk to draw outside. I'm really glad we tried this place!

Great burgers...never leave disappointed. Went the other night had a great burger and the fries pickles were awesome.....I love the fact that you never see the same server twice during your meal....it's like server roulette.....always my go to place for a good burger.

My Fiance and I would eat at Pinkys any day over any meal. Hands Down, our favorite Bar in Charlotte. We have been visiting for a few years now. Our favorite is the White trash burger with Pimpin fries with the chili and cheese. Ohhh my goshh, I send people to Pinkys all the time! Thank you guys at Pinkys for your awesome service as well!! If you go to Pinkys West Side Grill, don't forget to order the Bannana pudding. ((:

I used to go there for lunch all the time and get the Tahini Salad! Recently I visited after a long hiatus and relieved my taste buds as it always had!! Would love to try other items on the menu, but would hate to be steered away from the lovely tastes of my go to!! Customer service is great too, I've never had a problem there.

Great relaxed place to have a drink and a quick meal. I split a plate of fries with a friend and had a very well made vodka soda. We also tried the Girl Scout cookie cake which was to die for! It tasted exactly like a Samoa! The bartenders were all very nice and made is some Girl Scout themed shots which were tasty. I'll definitely be back to try their food, everything looked so good. Can't beat the prices either.

My friends just got a job at Panthers stadium and suggested we grab a quick bite. The diner had great character. It wasn't too big or too small. We both got the buffalo chicken fingers and as much dipping sauce as we wanted. My meal wasn't the most interesting thing on the menu, but it hit the spot!. The service was one of the best parts! I think we had three different waiters follow up with us throughout the meal. Next time I'm going to be a little bit more adventurous and get fried pickles!
Awesome is an understatement! Loved this place! I took my family of 8 and they all enjoyed it. Great appetizers as well as entrees.
White trash burger was awesome, got take out and it was super quick! Can't wait to order from there again

Great spot, great food. Tried this local spot while visiting Charlotte and I would definitely come here regularly if I lived in the area. The food is served HOT & fast. The entire staff serves you instead just waiting on one server. The atmosphere, music etc. is cool & chill.

Pinky's is a neat burger joint (they also have salads, hot dogs, and sandwiches for those of you that don't want a burger).   I went with my roommate and we started with the crab puppies appetizer which is basically a hush puppy with crab meat in them. The serving was pretty big - probably about 15 puppies and they were delicious. The dip they serve them with is great.   We both got the white trash burger which is a cheeseburger topped with fried pickles, onion straws, and a spicy ranch - 3 of my favorite things. It did not disappoint! My only critique is that they serve it on a regular old bun like you would buy at the grocery store. When I get a burger at a restaurant I would rather have it be on a really delicious bun - not one of the 8pack buns for a dollar.   We also order an order of the onion rings and waffle fries to split. The waffle fries were good. The onion rings were TERRIBLE. They are more like onion strings that weren't crispy and were greasy. I would not recommend anyone to order the onion rings.   They have a decent drink/cocktail menu and the prices are cheap! Great place to grab a drink.   Everything they serve to you is on plastic or paper (except drinks). We didn't even get any silverware. We didn't really need it, but it was strange not to have any silverware when you're dining at a restaurant.   They have a little mini arcade type area by the host/hostess stand great for kids. The decor is neat with an eclectic mix of different types of memorabilia.
Yummy food, not necessarily healthy, but great tasting!  Fried pickles are on point!

This is a place that knows what it is and does it the right way.  I've been here a few times, and every visit has been true to the following principles.  1) Food cooked to perfection. 2) Quick and attentive staff, from host to server to bartender, nobody leaves you hanging. 3) Clean location, quality, and a genuinely friendly staff.  If you find yourself in the uptown area, this is a no-brainer for a great lunch/dinner whatever.  My recommendations: White Trash Burger, Pickle Chips, Da Pimp, or if you are feeling extra southern - a double westside style (Chili, slaw, mustard, add cheese, boom goes the dynamite).  I'll be back time and time again.

It's just a pretty awesome place. Really cool vibe, waitstaff is awesome, food was really good to. Nice to go to a restaurant that has vegetarian stuff too ! Good portion size on everything Yeah I'm a big fan I'm definitely going back.

What a fun place with good ol fashion "junk" food, but the taste was fantastic.   We got some fantastic deep fried crab puppies.  They were full of crab and they came with some fantastic tartar sauce.  Another appetizer we got, which was the best thing we got was the Pimp'n Fries.  One of the best things I have ever have.  Waffle fries drenched in a pimento cheese mix.  Just fantastic.  Worth the calories and guilt when they are gone.  Get them!!!  We had burgers, chili dogs and a salad.  They were above average.  Not the best ever but good.  This place is legit because of all the comfort food options and the price is so cheap.  What a reasonable price for great food and beer.  The happy hour specials which are always going are fantastic.  This place will become a regular for me. Go and indulge !

If you are looking for a semi-grungy (but in a cool dive-y way, not dirty) place to eat on the Westside of Charlotte, Pinky's Westside Grill is the way to go. Owned by one of the former owners of The Penguin during that restaurant's renaissance, what was supposed to become The Penguin 2 ended up changing it's name to Pinky's but still featuring the same great burgers, chili, sandwiches and other great items. Little portions on big plates does not happen here. Here, you get more than you can eat at a very fair price, whether it's burgers, sandwiches or anything else they serve. For your health's sake, you may want to make it a treat instead of a staple, but it's still some of the best food in Charlotte and possibly some of the best burgers in the area!
Yay for fried pickles, the veggie burgers and beer selection. Cool setting
Had a great burger, chips and peach margherita there yesterday! Would highly recommend for lunch.

Slam Dunk!! It's our version of Hodads(a San Diego CA Historic eatery) in the South. The service was up to par. The price point did not cause sticker shock. I had the Triple G my boss had the Jive turkey. We also the banana pudding. This place earned a 5 Star ya, man from us. We will be back to haunt this place. The ONLY bummer is parking, but it is what it is....

So I lived in Charlotte for about 5 years during my years of undergrad and never ate at Pinky's - biggest mistake EVER! This place is amazing! When walking in, it's eclectic and a little wild but clean and cute. The restaurant isn't that big and fills up fast so you might need to call ahead or get there before the dinner rush. The prices are extremely reasonable and the flavors that come with the food with knock your tastebuds out of this world! The crab puppies are a must !!!!! The crab puppies will make you feel like your are sitting on the Maryland Harbor living it up! It is filled, i mean really really filled, with sweet crab meat that they don't hold back on. The puppies are big and just amazing! And the homemade tartar sauce is out of this world. Finally- the grilled chicken salad with crispy onions is MORE THAN AMAZING it is more than OUT OF THIS WORLD, it is heaven sent!!!!!! Although there is more chicken and onions than salad it's just too good to care! I would recommend, unless you really truly honestly love onions to leave the red onions out because the fried onions do a great job. Oh and the HOMEMADE RANCHHH! A true Southern just has a special place in their heart for well done homemade ranch and this one takes the cake. Overall, this is place you must stop and try and take extra socks because the food here will knock them off! Easily! Quickly! Truly and Honestly!

This is always going to be my late-night go to spot. The food always arrives fast and whenever I get in a mood for a corndog... I can order as many as I want without judgement!   AND the Banana Pudding will have you checking the kitchen for your grandma/auntie!! Lol

Decent food and very, very inexpensive.  What's not to like about that combo?  My wife got a Reuben Dog and I had a grilled chicken sandwich.  It's hard to mess up a hot dog and the toppings on this one were good so, on to the chicken.  A not all that thick boneless breast that had a nice sear and was still moist.  It was served on a soft sesame seed bun with fresh lettuce, swiss cheese, a good amount of bacon and some honey mustard sauce.  It was good and, again, it was cheap.  The service was friendly and my only complaint would be the tiny little paper baskets the food gets served in.  Sometimes hard to get in there and pick the sandwich up.  Oh yeah, I loved the Southern Slaw!   Overall, a nice addition to the LKN area.

This is my boyfriend's new favorite spot. He can't stop. And he wouldn't if he didn't have some adult supervision. (he almost ordered delivery through foodie call aka he was willing to eat the $20 delivery cost, as we live in university nowhere near either location.) The fried pickles are some of the best we've ever had. The ranch dip is exceptional, and usually ranch makes me gag.  Burger meat is soooo juicy, so delicious, so so good.  Waffle fries are basically Chick fil a's. I could live on them.  Sweet potato fries are satisfying.  Don't order the onion rings, unless you're interested in eating a pound of those weird crunchy onion straw things that go on top of green bean cassarole (not saying I've never done that) Corn dogs. What an underappreciated piece of heaven on a stick. My favorite.  We love the Craft beer roulet. They basically stick their hand in an ice bucket and for $3, you get whatever beer they pull out. Great way to venture out of your comfort zone.  Just come check it out.

Can't say I was all that impressed with the food. Based on the reviews, I was expecting something completely different. We started with the fried pickles. I don't think I've ever had a fried pickle I didn't like, until today. They had a smoky flavor...not sure if it was the batter but it was probably the worst I've had. I got the white trash burger and it lived up to the name. Just a mediocre burger. Not a whole lot of flavor. The waffle fries were decent but better at Chick-Fil-A. For the price, what you get is okay but I would rather spend more money and get something delicious. I really wanted to like this place but at the end of the day, I just don't. We won't be recommending Pinky's or returning.

It was a nice place in the middle of almost no where. Freedom dr doesn't have many places to sit and eat. The music was loud and the place itself was different. Not in a bad way at all. The food was good too. Very different and yummy. The serves could of been better. But I did go on a Saturday night when it was super busy. Their parking sucks. Very limited. You have to park across the street or behind the place itself. I would go again. Probably if I was in the area. I wouldn't make it a point to just drive there tho.
